definition[0]: a person or animal that has won something
example[0]: Five lucky winners will each receive a signed copy of the album.
example[1]: As a jockey he rode 10 winners.
example[3]: the winner of the Ladiesâ€™ Championship
definition[1]: someone or something that is or is likely to be very popular and successful
example[4]: The book has proved to be a winner with young children.
example[5]: The company seems to be onto a winner  (=doing something that is likely to be successful).
definition[2]: a goal or point that makes someone win a game such as football or tennis
example[6]: Moran scored the winner with only two minutes left.
definition[3]: the person who gets most of the advantages from a situation
example[7]: In a capitalist society there will always be winners and losers.
example[8]: The real winners this summer have been the sun cream manufacturers.
